FDG.function_description: Manage and view notes (empty state)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Notes page (empty state: 'Nothing here!'). They click the 'More options' icon (three vertical dots) at the top right. Since there's only one action here, the flow is a single step with no branches.

FDG.function_description: The current page is a side navigation menu in the Omni Notes Alpha app, providing options to navigate to the notes management page or access the app's settings.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the main notes page. The user clicks the hamburger menu icon, which opens the side navigation menu. From the menu, the user can then choose to navigate to the notes management page or access the app's settings, creating a branch point for these two mutually exclusive options.

steps.summary: Click the hamburger menu icon to open the side navigation menu

branches.condition: User selects 'Notes' to navigate to notes management page
User selects 'SETTINGS' to access app settings

steps.summary: Click the search icon on the notes page

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the notes page (page 0). They click the sort icon (action at [0,2]), which leads to page 2. This action likely initiates or relates to the voice input flow for searching notes, with the option to retry voice input by tapping the microphone icon.

steps.summary: Click the sort icon on the notes page

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to create a new note by selecting from options like Photo, Checklist, or Text note, while also providing a search bar for notes and an empty state indication when no notes are present.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the notes page (with empty state). First, they click the red circular add button to open the note creation menu. Then, they can click the close menu button to return to the main notes page.

Click close menu button to return to main notes page

FDG.function_description: The current page (side navigation menu) provides options to navigate to the "Notes" section (to manage and view notes) or to the "SETTINGS" section (to configure app preferences) within the Omni Notes Alpha application.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the side navigation menu page (page 1). From here, the user can click the 'Notes' option to navigate to the Notes section (though the destination page is still 1 in the action, implying a transition to the Notes - related page). There's also an option to click 'SETTINGS' (not included in the given action but part of the functional point's description, but since only the 'Notes' action is provided, the core logic here is the click on 'Notes' to navigate to the Notes management/viewing area).

steps.summary: Click on the 'Notes' navigation option

FDG.function_description: The current page is a side navigation menu in the Omni Notes Alpha app, providing options to navigate to the notes management page or access the app's settings.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the side navigation menu (page 1). First, the user clicks the 'Settings' option (action [1,1]) to navigate to the settings page (page 4). On the settings page, the user can choose to click 'Preferences' (action [4,0], staying on page 4), 'Data' (action [4,1] to page 5), or 'App tour' (action [4,9] to page 13). If 'Data' is clicked, from page 5, the user can click 'Sync and Backups' (action [5,0] to page 15) or 'Erase all data' (action [5,3] to page 13). From page 13, clicking 'CONFIRM' (action [13,0]) navigates to page 9. The flow branches based on which settings option is selected at page 4 and subsequent pages.

steps.summary: Click 'Settings' to navigate to settings page
Click 'Preferences' (stays on settings page)
Click 'Data' to navigate to data settings page
Click 'App tour' to navigate to app tour page
Click 'Sync and Backups' to navigate to sync/backups page
Click 'Erase all data' to navigate to app tour page
Click 'CONFIRM' to navigate to confirmation target page

FDG.function_description: This page functions as a camera interface for creating a photo note, allowing the user to capture an image (via the blue shutter button), switch camera modes (via the rotate icon), adjust settings (via the left icon), or exit the camera (via the 'X' button).

steps.summary: Click 'Photo' option to enter camera interface

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to create and manage a checklist - style note, including setting a title, adding checklist items, and viewing or modifying the reminder for the note.

core_logic.logic: To create a checklist note, start by clicking the 'Checklist note option' to open the note editor. Then, you can click the 'Title input field' to set a title, the 'New item checkbox' to add checklist items, or the 'Add reminder button' to set a reminder. For reminders, you can adjust time (via the clock picker, AM/PM toggle) or date (via navigation arrows, date selection, and confirm/cancel buttons), with options to switch between time and date pickers.

steps.summary: Open checklist note editor
Set note title
Add checklist item
Open reminder setup
Adjust time (clock picker)
Set AM for reminder
Set PM for reminder
Open date selection
Cancel reminder setup
Confirm reminder time
Previous month (date picker)
Next month (date picker)
Select reminder date
Cancel date selection
Confirm date selection
Switch to time picker

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 21 and clicks to open the application color scheme popup (step S1). Selecting an option (S3-S6) applies it, while canceling (S7) returns to the previous page.

Choose color scheme option
Select Disabled color scheme
Select Strip only color scheme
Select Notes list only color scheme
Select Complete color scheme
